name: Hampton Inn & Suites Spartanburg-I-26-Westgate Mall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night at this Hampton Inn. The reviews we read for the hotel were mostly good, and they were right. The room was of decent size--had a desk, desk chair, easy chair, microwave and small refrigerator and the room did not seem crowded at all.
reviews.title: About what we expected

reviews.text: When we first walked into the room, I thought they had left the windows open because it smelled so fresh and clean--but the window was closed. We were really impressed with the cleanliness of the room. The bed (king) had a strangely lumpy duvet on it, but that did not take away from the good night's sleep we had in the comfortable bed. The room was also very quiet.
reviews.title: You get your money's worth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was good--all kinds of cereals, muffins, etc. as well as sausage, omelets, bagel toppers, waffles, etc. The lady in charge of the dining area was quite helpful and accommodating.
reviews.title: Great People, Great Hotel

reviews.text: The Inn is right across the street from a very nice restaurant (not a chain!) where we had a delicious meal.
reviews.title: Worth the money!

reviews.text: Overall, a good Hampton Inn experience.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay, lovely staff

reviews.text: Wife and I were heading to mountains on spur of moment and needed place to stay. Ended up at this hotel as it had a room and was very impressed with cleanliness and friendly staff. Was so nice we stayed in a Suite the next night which is definitely worth the money. Staff was incredible help to people I saw and went out of their way to help me with issues on directions and other guests when asked. Would give higher rating except the rates we were given when calling in were $20 higher than the rates on internet or Hilton Website. Was asked about getting package for theater tickets and sweepstake entry that was advertised on the website booking, I was told that rates changed based on availability of rooms (???) and they could not give us the deal we could have gotten if we booked online. So much for low price guarentee.
reviews.title: Stayed twice, great suites, don't call for rates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very nice hotel. the hotel was in reach of all activities, such as the mall and restuarants. nice hotel personel. the complimentary breakfast was great. the room accommodations was nice and clean. you could not ask for a better place to stay. i cannot wait to go back!!!
reviews.title: slmiller

reviews.text: We stayed here on the way to our vacation destination. It is a very typical Hampton Inn and Suites. They are quite nice and affordable with a nice hot breakfast in the morning. The location of this Hampton Inn is a little tricky to find (a mall separates the hotel from the interstate and there are no signs to direct you) but it is in a nice quiet location away from hightway noise. Lots of restaurants, etc close by to take care of necessities. However,. what sets this apart and prompted this review is the staff. There were 3 separate shifts while we were there and all were extremely helpful and friendly. It may just have been our particular stay but the fact that the helpfullnes extended through 3 staff changes suggests that staff hiring and training at this hotel is excellent. We will definitely stay here next time we need a place to stay in Spartanburg, SC.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay here again!

reviews.text: Labor day weekend on our bikes we stopped in Spartanburg and checked in at the Hampton Inn. Front desk clerks Tonya and Treva were awesome! Very friendly. We love to joke around and have a good time. Alot of people just ignore that and go on about business, they were not like that, very friendly and made us feel right at home! Thanks so much for that! The hotel was great as usual with a Hampton Inn. Breakfast was great too! A great restaurant next door for dinner was a great recemendation by Treva and Tonya! Thanks guys!
reviews.title: Great stay-Tonya and Treva were awesome!

reviews.text: Stayed in a king suite with pull out sofabed. The room was great!!!!! This room was much larger than I anticipated, so much more floor space. It also contained a desk and chair, bar area/sink, microwave and fridge, also a sofa and comfortable chair.
reviews.title: Great property, very clean, very well decorated and comfortable. Friendly staff.

reviews.text: My family stayed at this hotel twice in 1 year. Great service, great room, free breakfast to start off the day that is pretty good. Would recommend and definitley will stay here again!
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: I recently stayed in this hotel for a business meeting and based on the reviews on TA, thought that this would be a clean, comfortable stay. I didn't have the same awesome experience that other reviewers did, but it was tolerable.
reviews.title: Not as impressed as other reviewers

reviews.text: Location
reviews.title: Great location, comfortable and friendly manager reception
DO NOT STAY HERE!
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location behind a mall off 1-26. There are a ton of restaurants nearby (two that you can walk to, or always go over to the mall). It was a bit back off the road so there was not a lot of road noise.
Check In/Lobby/Amenities
reviews.title: Simply Sweet!

reviews.text: We visit Spartanburg regularly and this was our first time staying at this hotel. The location is perfect for us. Check in was quick and front desk staff was very friendly. Room was furnished with large desk, dresser and unit with microwave and mini-fridge. Size was just right for 2, as was the bathroom. The room was clean and smelled fresh. We only stayed one evening, but slept well. We did not take breakfast since we were visiting family. But, did grab a cup of coffee. This hotel will be our first choice when visiting in the future.
reviews.title: Nice, well kept property in good location

reviews.text: This is was a good stay for a one night stopover. We were on our way to Myrtle beach and this put us about 4.5 - 5 hours from the beach. The rooms were clean, smelled fine, and nicely decorated. The only negative about this hotel was the breakfast area was not staffed adequately. There were long lines to get things because there was only 1 person refilling / and bring out new items. Besides the breakfast, the overall stay was very good.
reviews.title: Good Stay at Stop along our Trip

reviews.text: This was also a good location as there were many restuarants around for dinner and we were less that 1 mile from the interstate - but we never heard the interstate.
reviews.title: Ok hotel located near many stores and a cinema!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I saw some reviews that the internet speed was slow - but this was not the case for us - it was great!
reviews.title: Smelled like cat urine!

reviews.text: The hotel is just a little above average! There is a lot of stores around it and there is a good restaurant right next door. I had to unplug the fridge and turn of the air-condition to be able to sleep, they were both very loud!
reviews.title: Mixed experience

aka: Hampton Inn And Suites Spartanburg-i-26-Westgate Mall
description: Our Hampton Inn & Suites Spartanburg I-26 Westgate Mall hotel is located just off I-26 in Spartanburg, SC next to the Summit Pointe Conference & Events Center. Guests enjoy our free amenities from free wi-fi, hot breakfast, to our airport shuttle. Enjoy Tyger River Park offering 12 tournament baseball and softball fields.
